appframework_django_exceptions.yml.title: Django Framework Exceptions

appframework_django_exceptions.yml.author: Thomas Patzke

java_jndi_injection_exploitation_attempt.title: Potential JNDI Injection Exploitation In JVM Based Application
java_jndi_injection_exploitation_attempt.status: Detects potential JNDI Injection exploitation. Often coupled with Log4Shell exploitation.
java_jndi_injection_exploitation_attempt.description: Detects potential JNDI Injection exploitation. Often coupled with Log4Shell exploitation.
java_jndi_injection_exploitation_attempt.author: Moti Harmats

logsource.definition: Requirements: application error logs must be collected (with LOG_LEVEL=ERROR and above)

nodejs_rce_exploitation_attempt.yml.title: Potential RCE Exploitation Attempt In NodeJS
nodejs_rce_exploitation_attempt.yml.status: Detects process execution related errors in NodeJS. If the exceptions are caused due to user input then they may suggest an RCE vulnerability.
nodejs_rce_exploitation_attempt.yml.description: Detects process execution related errors in NodeJS. If the exceptions are caused due to user input then they may suggest an RCE vulnerability.
nodejs_rce_exploitation_attempt.yml.author: Moti Harmats

logsource.definition: Requirements: application error logs must be collected (with LOG_LEVEL=ERROR and above)

falsepositives: Puppeteer invocation exceptions often contain child_process related errors, that doesn't necessarily mean that the app is vulnerable.

app_python_sql_exceptions.yml.title: Python SQL Exceptions
app_python_sql_exceptions.yml.status: Generic rule for SQL exceptions in Python according to PEP 249

app_python_sql_exceptions.yml.author: Thomas Patzke

rpc_firewall_atsvc_lateral_movement.yml.description: Detects remote RPC calls to create or execute a scheduled task via ATSvc
rpc_firewall_atsvc_lateral_movement.yml.author: Sagie Dulce, Dekel Paz

logsource.definition: Requirements: install and apply the RPC Firewall to all processes with "audit:true action:block uuid:1ff70682-0a51-30e8-076d-740be8cee98b"

app_sqlinjection_errors.yml.title: Suspicious SQL Error Messages
app_sqlinjection_errors.yml.status: Detects SQL error messages that indicate probing for an injection attack
app_sqlinjection_errors.yml.description: Detects SQL error messages that indicate probing for an injection attack
app_sqlinjection_errors.yml.author: Bjoern Kimminich

logsource.definition: Requirements: application error logs must be collected (with LOG_LEVEL ERROR and above)

keywords: You have an error in your SQL syntax
SELECTs to the left and right of UNION do not have the same number of result columns

falsepositives: A syntax error in MySQL also occurs in non-dynamic (safe) queries if there is an empty in() clause, that may often be the case.

velocity_ssti_injection.yml.title: Potential Server Side Template Injection In Velocity
velocity_ssti_injection.yml.status: Detects exceptions in velocity template renderer, this most likely happens due to dynamic rendering of user input and may lead to RCE.
velocity_ssti_injection.yml.description: Detects exceptions in velocity template renderer, this most likely happens due to dynamic rendering of user input and may lead to RCE.
velocity_ssti_injection.yml.author: Moti Harmats

logsource.definition: Requirements: application error logs must be collected (with LOG_LEVEL=ERROR and above)

av_exploiting.yml.title: Antivirus Exploitation Framework Detection
av_exploiting.yml.status: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports an exploitation framework
av_exploiting.yml.description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports an exploitation framework
av_exploiting.yml.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Arnim Rupp

db_anomalous_query.yml.title: Suspicious SQL Query
db_anomalous_query.yml.status: Detects suspicious SQL query keywrods that are often used during recon, exfiltration or destructive activities. Such as dropping tables and selecting wildcard fields
db_anomalous_query.yml.description: Detects suspicious SQL query keywrods that are often used during recon, exfiltration or destructive activities. Such as dropping tables and selecting wildcard fields
db_anomalous_query.yml.author: @juju4

logsource.definition: Requirements: Must be able to log the SQL queries

aws_attached_malicious_lambda_layer.yml.title: AWS Attached Malicious Lambda Layer
aws_attached_malicious_lambda_layer.yml.status:
Detects when an user attached a Lambda layer to an existing function to override a library that is in use by the function, where their malicious code could utilize the function's IAM role for AWS API calls.
This would give an adversary access to the privileges associated with the Lambda service role that is attached to that function.
aws_attached_malicious_lambda_layer.yml.description:
Detects when an user attached a Lambda layer to an existing function to override a library that is in use by the function, where their malicious code could utilize the function's IAM role for AWS API calls.
This would give an adversary access to the privileges associated with the Lambda service role that is attached to that function.
aws_attached_malicious_lambda_layer.yml.author: Austin Songer
falsepositives: Lambda Layer being attached may be performed by a system administrator. Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment.
Lambda Layer being attached from unfamiliar users should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule.

azure_aadhybridhealth_adfs_new_server.ym.title: Azure Active Directory Hybrid Health AD FS New Server
azure_aadhybridhealth_adfs_new_server.ym.status:
This detection uses azureactivity logs (Administrative category) to identify the creation or update of a server instance in an Azure AD Hybrid health AD FS service.
A threat actor can create a new AD Health ADFS service and create a fake server instance to spoof AD FS signing logs. There is no need to compromise an on-prem AD FS server.
This can be done programmatically via HTTP requests to Azure.
azure_aadhybridhealth_adfs_new_server.ym.description:
This detection uses azureactivity logs (Administrative category) to identify the creation or update of a server instance in an Azure AD Hybrid health AD FS service.
A threat actor can create a new AD Health ADFS service and create a fake server instance to spoof AD FS signing logs. There is no need to compromise an on-prem AD FS server.
This can be done programmatically via HTTP requests to Azure.
azure_aadhybridhealth_adfs_new_server.ym.author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), MSTIC
falsepositives: Legitimate AD FS servers added to an AAD Health AD FS service instance

azure_aad_secops_ca_policy_removedby_bad.title: CA Policy Removed by Non Approved Actor
azure_aad_secops_ca_policy_removedby_bad.status: Monitor and alert on conditional access changes where non approved actor removed CA Policy.
azure_aad_secops_ca_policy_removedby_bad.description: Monitor and alert on conditional access changes where non approved actor removed CA Policy.
azure_aad_secops_ca_policy_removedby_bad.author: Corissa Koopmans, '@corissalea'
falsepositives: Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment.

azure_identity_protection_anomalous_toke.title: Anomalous Token
azure_identity_protection_anomalous_toke.status: Indicates that there are abnormal characteristics in the token such as an unusual token lifetime or a token that is played from an unfamiliar location.
azure_identity_protection_anomalous_toke.description: Indicates that there are abnormal characteristics in the token such as an unusual token lifetime or a token that is played from an unfamiliar location.
azure_identity_protection_anomalous_toke.author: Mark Morowczynski '@markmorow'
falsepositives: We recommend investigating the sessions flagged by this detection in the context of other sign-ins from the user.

azure_pim_account_stale.yml.title: Stale Accounts In A Privileged Role
azure_pim_account_stale.yml.status: Identifies when an account hasn't signed in during the past n number of days.
azure_pim_account_stale.yml.description: Identifies when an account hasn't signed in during the past n number of days.
azure_pim_account_stale.yml.author: Mark Morowczynski '@markmorow', Gloria Lee, '@gleeiamglo'
falsepositives: Investigate if potential generic account that cannot be removed.

azure_account_lockout.yml.title: Account Lockout
azure_account_lockout.yml.status: Identifies user account which has been locked because the user tried to sign in too many times with an incorrect user ID or password.
azure_account_lockout.yml.description: Identifies user account which has been locked because the user tried to sign in too many times with an incorrect user ID or password.
azure_account_lockout.yml.author: AlertIQ

gcp_bucket_enumeration.yml.title: Google Cloud Storage Buckets Enumeration
gcp_bucket_enumeration.yml.status: Detects when storage bucket is enumerated in Google Cloud.
gcp_bucket_enumeration.yml.description: Detects when storage bucket is enumerated in Google Cloud.
gcp_bucket_enumeration.yml.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger
falsepositives: Storage Buckets being enumerated may be performed by a system administrator. Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment.
Storage Buckets enumerated from unfamiliar users should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule.

gcp_gworkspace_application_removed.yml.title: Google Workspace Application Removed
gcp_gworkspace_application_removed.yml.status: Detects when an an application is removed from Google Workspace.
gcp_gworkspace_application_removed.yml.description: Detects when an an application is removed from Google Workspace.
gcp_gworkspace_application_removed.yml.author: Austin Songer
falsepositives: Application being removed may be performed by a System Administrator.

github_delete_action_invoked.yml.title: Github Delete Action Invoked
github_delete_action_invoked.yml.status: Detects delete action in the Github audit logs for codespaces, environment, project and repo.
github_delete_action_invoked.yml.description: Detects delete action in the Github audit logs for codespaces, environment, project and repo.
github_delete_action_invoked.yml.author: Muhammad Faisal

logsource.definition: Requirements: The audit log streaming feature must be enabled to be able to receive such logs. You can enable following the documentation here: https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/admin/monitoring-activity-in-your-enterprise/reviewing-audit-logs-for-your-enterprise/streaming-the-audit-log-for-your-enterprise#setting-up-audit-log-streaming

falsepositives: Validate the deletion activity is permitted. The "actor" field need to be validated.

microsoft365_disabling_mfa.yml.title: Disabling Multi Factor Authentication
microsoft365_disabling_mfa.yml.status: Detects disabling of Multi Factor Authentication.
microsoft365_disabling_mfa.yml.description: Detects disabling of Multi Factor Authentication.
microsoft365_disabling_mfa.yml.author: Splunk Threat Research Team (original rule), Harjot Singh @cyb3rjy0t (sigma rule)

microsoft365_new_federated_domain_added_.title: New Federated Domain Added - Exchange
microsoft365_new_federated_domain_added_.status: Detects the addition of a new Federated Domain.
microsoft365_new_federated_domain_added_.description: Detects the addition of a new Federated Domain.
microsoft365_new_federated_domain_added_.author: Splunk Threat Research Team (original rule), '@ionsor (rule)'
falsepositives: The creation of a new Federated domain is not necessarily malicious, however these events need to be followed closely, as it may indicate federated credential abuse or backdoor via federated identities at a similar or different cloud provider.

microsoft365_from_susp_ip_addresses.yml.title: Activity from Suspicious IP Addresses
microsoft365_from_susp_ip_addresses.yml.status:
Detects when a Microsoft Cloud App Security reported users were active from an IP address identified as risky by Microsoft Threat Intelligence.
These IP addresses are involved in malicious activities, such as Botnet C&C, and may indicate compromised account.
microsoft365_from_susp_ip_addresses.yml.description:
Detects when a Microsoft Cloud App Security reported users were active from an IP address identified as risky by Microsoft Threat Intelligence.
These IP addresses are involved in malicious activities, such as Botnet C&C, and may indicate compromised account.
microsoft365_from_susp_ip_addresses.yml.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger

microsoft365_activity_by_terminated_user.title: Activity Performed by Terminated User
microsoft365_activity_by_terminated_user.status:
Detects when a Microsoft Cloud App Security reported for users whose account were terminated in Azure AD, but still perform activities in other platforms such as AWS or Salesforce.
This is especially relevant for users who use another account to manage resources, since these accounts are often not terminated when a user leaves the company.
microsoft365_activity_by_terminated_user.description:
Detects when a Microsoft Cloud App Security reported for users whose account were terminated in Azure AD, but still perform activities in other platforms such as AWS or Salesforce.
This is especially relevant for users who use another account to manage resources, since these accounts are often not terminated when a user leaves the company.
microsoft365_activity_by_terminated_user.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger

okta_admin_role_assigned_to_user_or_grou.title: Okta Admin Role Assigned to an User or Group
okta_admin_role_assigned_to_user_or_grou.status: Detects when an the Administrator role is assigned to an user or group.
okta_admin_role_assigned_to_user_or_grou.description: Detects when an the Administrator role is assigned to an user or group.
okta_admin_role_assigned_to_user_or_grou.author: Austin Songer @austinsonger
falsepositives: Administrator roles could be assigned to users or group by other admin users.

onelogin_assumed_another_user.yml.title: OneLogin User Assumed Another User
onelogin_assumed_another_user.yml.status: Detects when an user assumed another user account.
onelogin_assumed_another_user.yml.description: Detects when an user assumed another user account.

default_credentials_usage.yml.title: Default Credentials Usage
default_credentials_usage.yml.status:
Before deploying any new asset, change all default passwords to have values consistent with administrative level accounts.
Sigma detects default credentials usage. Sigma for Qualys vulnerability scanner. Scan type - Vulnerability Management.
default_credentials_usage.yml.description:
Before deploying any new asset, change all default passwords to have values consistent with administrative level accounts.
Sigma detects default credentials usage. Sigma for Qualys vulnerability scanner. Scan type - Vulnerability Management.
default_credentials_usage.yml.author: Alexandr Yampolskyi, SOC Prime

proc_creation_lnx_at_command.yml.title: Scheduled Task/Job At
proc_creation_lnx_at_command.yml.status:
Detects the use of at/atd which are utilities that are used to schedule tasks.
They are often abused by adversaries to maintain persistence or to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code

create_stream_hash_ads_executable.yml.title: Hidden Executable In NTFS Alternate Data Stream

create_stream_hash_ads_executable.yml.description: Detects the creation of an ADS (Alternate Data Stream) that contains an executable by looking at a non-empty Imphash
create_stream_hash_ads_executable.yml.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), @0xrawsec

logsource.definition: Requirements: Sysmon or equivalent configured with Imphash logging

falsepositives: This rule isn't looking for any particular binary characteristics. As legitimate installers and programs were seen embedding hidden binaries in their ADS. Some false positives are expected from browser processes and similar.

driver_load_win_mal_creddumper.yml.title: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution
driver_load_win_mal_creddumper.yml.status: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events
driver_load_win_mal_creddumper.yml.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events
driver_load_win_mal_creddumper.yml.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
falsepositives: Legitimate Administrator using credential dumping tool for password recovery

file_access_win_browser_credential_acces.title: Access To Browser Credential Files By Uncommon Application
file_access_win_browser_credential_acces.status:
Detects file access requests to browser credential stores by uncommon processes.
Could indicate potential attempt of credential stealing.
Requires heavy baselining before usage
file_access_win_browser_credential_acces.description:
Detects file access requests to browser credential stores by uncommon processes.
Could indicate potential attempt of credential stealing.
Requires heavy baselining before usage
file_access_win_browser_credential_acces.author: frack113

detection.condition: 1 of selection_* and not 1 of filter_main_* and not 1 of filter_optional_*

falsepositives: Legitimate software installed on partitions other than "C:\"

file_change_win_2022_timestomping.yml.title: File Creation Date Changed to Another Year
file_change_win_2022_timestomping.yml.status:
Attackers may change the file creation time of a backdoor to make it look like it was installed with the operating system.
Note that many processes legitimately change the creation time of a file; it does not necessarily indicate malicious activity.
file_change_win_2022_timestomping.yml.description:
Attackers may change the file creation time of a backdoor to make it look like it was installed with the operating system.
Note that many processes legitimately change the creation time of a file; it does not necessarily indicate malicious activity.
file_change_win_2022_timestomping.yml.author: frack113, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

detection.condition: (( selection1 and not filter1 ) or ( selection2 and not filter2 )) and not 1 of gen_filter*

falsepositives: Changes made to or by the local NTP service

file_delete_win_cve_2021_1675_print_nigh.title: Potential PrintNightmare Exploitation Attempt
file_delete_win_cve_2021_1675_print_nigh.status: Detect DLL deletions from Spooler Service driver folder. This might be a potential exploitation attempt of CVE-2021-1675
file_delete_win_cve_2021_1675_print_nigh.description: Detect DLL deletions from Spooler Service driver folder. This might be a potential exploitation attempt of CVE-2021-1675
file_delete_win_cve_2021_1675_print_nigh.author: Bhabesh Raj

file_event_win_access_susp_teams.yml.title: Suspicious File Event With Teams Objects
file_event_win_access_susp_teams.yml.status: Detects an access to authentication tokens and accounts of Microsoft Teams desktop application.

file_event_win_access_susp_teams.yml.author: @SerkinValery

file_rename_win_not_dll_to_dll.yml.title: Rename Common File to DLL File
file_rename_win_not_dll_to_dll.yml.status: Detects cases in which a file gets renamed to .dll, which often happens to bypass perimeter protection
file_rename_win_not_dll_to_dll.yml.description: Detects cases in which a file gets renamed to .dll, which often happens to bypass perimeter protection
file_rename_win_not_dll_to_dll.yml.author: frack113

logsource.definition: Requirements: Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-File Provider with at least the KERNEL_FILE_KEYWORD_RENAME_SETLINK_PATH keyword

image_load_cmstp_load_dll_from_susp_loca.title: DLL Loaded From Suspicious Location Via Cmspt.EXE
image_load_cmstp_load_dll_from_susp_loca.status: Detects cmstp loading "dll" or "ocx" files from suspicious locations

image_load_cmstp_load_dll_from_susp_loca.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

net_connection_win_addinutil.yml.title: Network Connection Initiated By AddinUtil.EXE
net_connection_win_addinutil.yml.status: Detects network connections made by the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe), which could indicate command and control communication.
net_connection_win_addinutil.yml.description: Detects network connections made by the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe), which could indicate command and control communication.
net_connection_win_addinutil.yml.author: Michael McKinley (@McKinleyMike), Tony Latteri (@TheLatteri)

pipe_created_csexec_default_pipe.yml.title: CSExec Default Named Pipe
pipe_created_csexec_default_pipe.yml.author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

logsource.definition: Note that you have to configure logging for Named Pipe Events in Sysmon config (Event ID 17 and Event ID 18). The basic configuration is in popular sysmon configuration (https://github.com/SwiftOnSecurity/sysmon-config), but it is worth verifying. You can also use other repo, e.g. https://github.com/Neo23x0/sysmon-config, https://github.com/olafhartong/sysmon-modular. How to test detection? You can check powershell script from this site https://svch0st.medium.com/guide-to-named-pipes-and-hunting-for-cobalt-strike-pipes-dc46b2c5f575

posh_pc_abuse_nslookup_with_dns_records..title: Nslookup PowerShell Download Cradle
posh_pc_abuse_nslookup_with_dns_records..status: Detects suspicious powershell download cradle using nslookup. This cradle uses nslookup to extract payloads from DNS records
posh_pc_abuse_nslookup_with_dns_records..description: Detects suspicious powershell download cradle using nslookup. This cradle uses nslookup to extract payloads from DNS records
posh_pc_abuse_nslookup_with_dns_records..author: Sai Prashanth Pulisetti @pulisettis, Aishwarya Singam

logsource.definition: fields have to be extract from event

posh_pm_active_directory_module_dll_impo.title: Potential Active Directory Enumeration Using AD Module - PsModule
posh_pm_active_directory_module_dll_impo.status: Detects usage of the "Import-Module" cmdlet to load the "Microsoft.ActiveDirectory.Management.dl" DLL. Which is often used by attackers to perform AD enumeration.
posh_pm_active_directory_module_dll_impo.description: Detects usage of the "Import-Module" cmdlet to load the "Microsoft.ActiveDirectory.Management.dl" DLL. Which is often used by attackers to perform AD enumeration.
posh_pm_active_directory_module_dll_impo.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113
falsepositives: Legitimate use of the library for administrative activity

posh_ps_aadinternals_cmdlets_execution.y.title: AADInternals PowerShell Cmdlets Execution - PsScript
posh_ps_aadinternals_cmdlets_execution.y.status: Detects ADDInternals Cmdlet execution. A tool for administering Azure AD and Office 365. Which can be abused by threat actors to attack Azure AD or Office 365.
posh_ps_aadinternals_cmdlets_execution.y.description: Detects ADDInternals Cmdlet execution. A tool for administering Azure AD and Office 365. Which can be abused by threat actors to attack Azure AD or Office 365.
posh_ps_aadinternals_cmdlets_execution.y.author: Austin Songer (@austinsonger), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

logsource.definition: Script Block Logging must be enable

falsepositives: Legitimate use of the library for administrative activity

proc_access_win_cmstp_execution_by_acces.title: CMSTP Execution Process Access
proc_access_win_cmstp_execution_by_acces.status: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
proc_access_win_cmstp_execution_by_acces.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
proc_access_win_cmstp_execution_by_acces.author: Nik Seetharaman
falsepositives: Legitimate CMSTP use (unlikely in modern enterprise environments)

proc_creation_win_7zip_exfil_dmp_files.y.title: 7Zip Compressing Dump Files
proc_creation_win_7zip_exfil_dmp_files.y.status: Detects execution of 7z in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.
proc_creation_win_7zip_exfil_dmp_files.y.description: Detects execution of 7z in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.
proc_creation_win_7zip_exfil_dmp_files.y.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
falsepositives: Legitimate use of 7z with a command line in which ".dmp" or ".dump" appears accidentally
Legitimate use of 7z to compress WER ".dmp" files for troubleshooting

proc_tampering_process_hollowing.yml.title: Potential Process Hollowing Activity
proc_tampering_process_hollowing.yml.status: Detects when a memory process image does not match the disk image, indicative of process hollowing.

proc_tampering_process_hollowing.yml.author: Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io', Sittikorn S

raw_access_thread_disk_access_using_ille.status: Detects raw disk access using uncommon tools or tools that are located in suspicious locations (heavy filtering is required), which could indicate possible defense evasion attempts

registry_delete_exploit_guard_protected_.title: Folder Removed From Exploit Guard ProtectedFolders List - Registry
registry_delete_exploit_guard_protected_.status: Detects the removal of folders from the "ProtectedFolders" list of of exploit guard. This could indicate an attacker trying to launch an encryption process or trying to manipulate data inside of the protected folder
registry_delete_exploit_guard_protected_.description: Detects the removal of folders from the "ProtectedFolders" list of of exploit guard. This could indicate an attacker trying to launch an encryption process or trying to manipulate data inside of the protected folder
registry_delete_exploit_guard_protected_.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

selection.TargetObject|contains: SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Windows Defender Exploit Guard\Controlled Folder Access\ProtectedFolders

falsepositives: Legitimate administrators removing applications (should always be investigated)
